title: Francis' unlikely heroics lift Southern
text:
More coverage: Southeastern Pa. high school sports With less than a minute to play in the Public League Liberty Division contest, Francis tracked Mastbaum quarterback Derrick McLean as he scrambled near midfield.
"I saw the quarterback running and my coaches always taught me to just run down the line," Francis said. "Then I saw him throw it, saw it in the air, and just made a play and caught it." 
After the theft, Francis barreled over three defenders before being tackled near the Mastbaum 45. 
"This was very important," he said. "Our first-string guy [Williams] was hurt and I usually fill in for him. But tonight, I was first-string and this was the first time I played the entire game. I'm very excited that we won." 
Martell Marshall led Southern (3-2, 4-3) with 180 yards rushing and a touchdown on 21 carries. 
The senior missed several plays throughout the contest because of cramps. Junior quarterback Marvin Fleming added 53 rushing yards and two touchdowns. 
For the Panthers (1-4, 2-5), Terrel Brent, a junior, finished with 166 yards and two touchdowns on 17 carries. He also forced a fumble on the defensive end. 
Mastbaum surprised the Rams by grabbing a 6-0 lead in the first quarter. The Panthers led late after Terry Mumford's 96-yard fumble return with 11 minutes, 2 seconds left in the fourth. 
Fleming punched in the eventual game-winning score, a 5-yard run with 5:53 left. 
That just left Francis' unlikely heroics. 
The native of Jamaica attends Audenried, which doesn't have a football team. He played mostly junior varsity at Southern last year, his first playing football. 
"This feels good," he said. "But at the same time I know I can do better. I want to improve and not make everybody surprised that I can do this and do it more consistently." 
Southern 0 8 6 8 - 22 
Mastbaum 6 0 6 6 - 18 
M: Terrel Brent 12 run (kick blocked) 
S: Martell Marshall 2 run (Samid Williams from Marvin Fleming) 
M: Terrel Brent 89 run (run failed) 
S: Marvin Fleming 1 run (run failed) 
M: Terry Mumford 96 fumble (pass failed) 
S: Fleming 5 run (Marshall run)
